debug_mode_enabled.description: Should we perform general debugging (everything that isn't specified in other options)

chat_input_command_api_data.description: Should the Discord API Command data be displayed when registering?

interactions.description: Should interaction objects be debugged when received?

autocomplete_execution_time.description: Should the time it takes to query auto-completes be displayed

modal_submit_execution_time.description: Should the time it takes to respond to modal submit interactions be displayed? Useful because these interaction can't be deferred

command_throttling.description: Should command usage throttling be debugged?

command_data.description: Should a table with a complete overview of commands be displayed on boot?

debug.description: Debug configuration for this instance, useful for developers

colors.description: Color customization for embeds, and other user feedback/interactions

emojis.description: Emoji customization for embeds, and other user feedback/interactions

github.description: The URL to the project repository

docs.description: The URL to the project documentation

website.description: The URL to the project website

support_server.description: The URL to the project support server

max_size.description: Whats the max size of a file before it should rotate

max_files.description: Whats the max amount of files to keep before deleting the oldest

zipped_archive.description: Should rotated log files be archived, instead of deleted?

directory.description: What directory should log files be stored in?

date_pattern.description: What date pattern should be used for log file names

combined_logging.description: Should there be a combined log file that holds everything?

error_logging.description: Should there be an error log file?

warn_logging.description: Should there be a warning log file?

info_logging.description: Should there be an info log file?

http_logging.description: Should there be an http log file?

verbose_logging.description: Should there be a verbose log file?

debug_logging.description: Should there be a debug log file?

silly_logging.description: Should there be a silly log file?

$schema.description: JSON schema used for validation and type-ahead/Intellisense, you should never change this

client.description: Discord client/bot configuration for this instance

cluster.description: Change the entry file of this application to further fine-tune sharding and clustering settings

enabled.description: Whether the API should be enabled

port.description:
Which port the server application should run on, between `0` and `65535` (disabled if `null`)

Note: Port range `[0-1024]` should be considered reserved as they're well-known ports, these require SuperUser/Administrator access

Note: Port range `[49152-65535]` should be considered reserved for Ephemeral Ports (Unix based devices, configurable)

Reference:  {@link  https://www.ncftp.com/ncftpd/doc/misc/ephemeral_ports.html }

owner_id.description: The bot owner's Discord user id - represents the highest permission level

developer_ids.description: Array of Discord user id's that have the Developer permission level

system_administrator_ids.description: Array of Discord user id's that should be able to manage the bot - like restarting, viewing logs, audits, etc.

default_lock_member_permissions.description: If a command has a permission level of Administrator, should we automatically hide that command from non-Administrator users, by using `#setDefaultMemberPermissions(0)` on the command?

id.description: This client's application/user ID. You can get one here: https://discord.com/developers/applications

token.description: The secret token used to log in to this bot account. You can get one here: https://discord.com/developers/applications

development_server_id.description: The server/guild id where test commands should be registered to - development only

refuse_unknown_command_interactions.description: Should we refuse, and reply to, interactions that belong to unknown commands?

suppress_unknown_interaction_warnings.description: Should we suppress warnings about unknown interactions? You should enable this if you run multiple applications/processes under the same bot account used for this client, or register a lot of  command-scoped component listeners/collectors

error_channel_id.description: The id of the channel where internal errors should be logged to

command_usage_channel_id.description: Should we log command/component usage in a Discord channel (id)?

presence.description: The default client status and activities, set when the client is ready. This is only set once on boot, and not updated afterwards.

default_cooldown_enabled.description: Whether command throttling is enabled by default

default_cooldown_type.description: What resource/identifier this cooldown should apply to

default_cooldown_usages.description: The amount of time the command can be used before being throttled

default_cooldown_duration.description: The duration (in ms) usages last for

default_cooldown_persistent.description: Whether the cooldown is persistent (i.e. does it persist between bot restarts)? If true, uses prisma data to store cooldown (slower). If false, uses internal memory TTL cache to store cooldown for as long as they're relevant (faster, uses more RAM)

ICommandCooldown.description: Represents a command throttling configuration that is unique to our config.json file

total_shards.description: Total amount of shards to spawn, use null for auto

total_clusters.description: Amount of clusters to spawn, use null for auto

respawn.description: Should the process respawn on exit

max.description: Maximum amount of restarts a cluster can have in the interval

interval.description: Interval in milliseconds on which the current restarts amount of a cluster will be resetted

IClusterRestartOptions.description:
Represents essential options to configure clustering & sharding

Unfortunately we still can't use this to generate our json schema as it's not supported by the generator (bigint)
